goal.ch: 本課程旨在提供學生在實際工作環境中應用數學知識和技能的機會，幫助他們理解數學在不同產業中的應用，並培養解決問題和合作能力。
goal.en: This course aims to provide students with opportunities to apply mathematical knowledge and skills in real-world working environments, helping them understand the applications of mathematics in various industries, and cultivate problem-solving and collaboration abilities.

outline.ch: 本課程提供學生於校外實習時數轉換為畢業學分的管道。於課程進行前需進行實習行前說明會，詳細說明實習應注意事項。本課程內容彈性很大，主要由學生提出校外實習規劃書，經本系課程委員會通過後始得修習本課程，並由授課教師針對規劃書考評學生的實習內容是否符合規劃書所載內容。
outline.en: This course provides a pathway for students to convert internship hours conducted off-campus into graduation credits. Before the course commences, a pre-internship briefing session is required to provide detailed instructions on internship procedures. The content of this course is highly flexible, primarily driven by students submitting an off-campus internship proposal. Upon approval by the department‘s curriculum committee, students may then enroll in the course. The teaching faculty will assess whether the internship content aligns with the proposal outlined in the internship plan.

gradMethod.ch:
1.實習單位評價：根據實習單位的評價，評估學生在實習期間的表現和成就。此部份佔學期成績60％。
2.實習報告：學生寫的實習報告，描述他們的工作任務和學習收穫。此部份佔學期成績40％。
gradMethod.en:
1.Internship Unit Evaluation: Based on the assessment from the internship unit, evaluate students‘ performance and achievements during the internship period. This component accounts for 60％ of the semester grade.
2.Internship Report: Reports written by students describing their job responsibilities and learning outcomes during the internship. This component accounts for 40％ of the semester grade.
